modules.description: This module provides functions to dispatch and manage jobs in a persistent MariaDB-backed queue, supporting job registration, delayed execution, and context-based job handling. It works with job data structures defined in `Sihl__.Contract_queue`, including job identifiers, contexts, and delay specifications. Concrete use cases include enqueuing background tasks like email delivery or batch processing with guaranteed persistence and job ordering control.

This module implements a persistent job queue using PostgreSQL, providing operations to enqueue jobs, batch enqueue jobs with reversed processing order, register executable job handlers, and serve a dashboard for monitoring. It works with job data structures that include processing functions and context metadata, along with Ptime.span for scheduling delays. Concrete use cases include background task processing, delayed job execution, and managing job lifecycles through a PostgreSQL-backed queue.

This module provides in-memory job queuing with non-persistent, unbounded storage. It supports job dispatching with optional delays, batch dispatching in reverse order, and job registration for later execution. Use it to handle temporary background tasks during testing where data loss on shutdown is acceptable.

This module defines job and instance data structures for managing background tasks, including status tracking, retries, and scheduling. It provides operations to create and dispatch jobs with custom handling logic, format job and instance data, and determine job execution timing. The module supports concrete use cases like processing queued email deliveries, executing delayed batch operations, and managing task lifecycles with retry policies.
